faqs.question: How does Weatherford's mixed soil affect pumping needs?
faqs.answer: Sandy loam areas drain faster but filter less, making regular pumping important for groundwater protection. Clay areas drain slowly, stressing drain fields that need protection from solid waste migration. Either way, pumping every three to five years is recommended, with adjustments based on your specific soil type.

faqs.question: How often should Weatherford ranch properties pump?
faqs.answer: Older ranch properties with aging tanks should pump every two to three years. Newer systems on ranch properties can follow the standard three to five year schedule depending on household size. Well water proximity is an additional consideration for rural properties where groundwater contamination risk is more direct.
